Description: Body and rim sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery Castulo cup; fine lustrous black glaze on interior and exterior; low concave rim; substantial difference between offsets inside and out; thick walls, fairly shallow body.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in: D. G. Hogarth, H. L. Lorimer & C. C. Edgar, Naukratis 1903, Journal of Hellenic Studies, vol. 25 (1905), p. 116, fig. 2, no. 9. Compare Athenian Agora, vol. XII, no. 471.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 707, no. 652, pl. 26.11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1665)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
